required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Contact Activation System and Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: The Contact Activation System and Ulcerative Colitis

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to describe alterations in the contact activation system during active and inactive ulcerative colitis.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study is a part of a Ph.d. project anchored at the Department of Medical Gastroenterology and the Unit of Thrombosis Research at the University Hospital of Southern Denmark - Esbjerg.
A total of 47 participants with active disease are to be followed in a prospective cohort study for 26 weeks. The study will describe differences between active and inactive disease.
Data obtained from all participants are
- demographics
- assessment of quality of life (SIBDQ questionnaire)
- assessment of disease activity (SCCAI questionnaire, PRO 2 questionnaire, endoscopic Mayo score, histologic score by the Nancy index, c-reactive peptide and fecal calprotectin)
- assessment of the concentration and activity of the contact activation system proteins
- assessment of misfolded alpha-1-antitrypsin.
- assessment of ER stress (GRP78/BiP)
The endoscopic and histologic assessment serve as the gold standard.
Medias analyzed are blood, stool and colonic tissue.

primary_outcome.description: FXII concentration in plasma, stool and cell lysate.
PK concentration in plasma, stool and cell lysate.
The amount of PKa generated upon FXII activation in plasma, stool and cell lysate.
The concentration of native HK in plasma, stool and cell lysate. Colonic biopsies are stained to detect the presence of native HK.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 26 weeksa in plasma, stool and cell lysate.
primary_outcome.description: The amount of HK cleaved by PKa in plasma, stool and cell lysate. Colonic biopsies are stained to detect the presence of PKa cleaved HK.
The amount of HK cleaved by TKa in plasma, stool and cell lysate. Colonic biopsies are stained to detect the presence of TKa cleaved HK.
The concentration of C1 Inh in plasma, stool and cell lysate.
The concentration of polymerized AAT in plasma, stool and cell lysate. Colonic biopsies are stained to detect polymerized AAT.
The concentration of elastase in plasma, stool and cell lysate.
The amount of thrombin generated upon FXII activation in plasma, stool and cell lysate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Simple Clinical Colitis Activity Index questionnaire (SCCAI)
secondary_outcome.description: SCCAI score range: 0-21. Score >5 indicate disease activity. The higher score the more disease activity.
PRO2 score range: 0-6. The higher score the more disease activity.
Quality of life assessed in relation to disease activity. Score range: The higher score, the worse quality of life.
Endoscopic assessment of disease severity. Score range: 0-3. The higher score the worse severity.
Histologic assessment of disease severity in colonic biopsies. Score range: Grad 0-4. The higher score the worse severity.
The concentration of CRP in plasma.
The concentration of calprotectin in stool.

intervention.intervention_name: Consecutively assessment of the disease activity
intervention.description: Analyzes listed in the detailed study description is measured consecutively. SIBDQ and lower endoscopy are performed at only 3 visits. The remaining analyzes are performed at each visit.

biospec_descr.textblock: Plasma, stool and fixated colonic tissue.

study_pop.textblock: Patients are enrolled from the Department of Medical Gastroenterology at the Hospital of Southwest Jutland, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Fulfill diagnostic criteria of ulcerative colitis
- SCCAI score ≥ 5
- Mayo Endoscopic Subscore ≥ 1
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Most understand written and oral information in Danish
- Informed consent must be given
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Infection at inclusion
- Any existing disease at inclusion:
- liver disease or defect in CAS
- inflammatory rheumatologic or dermatologic disease
- cardiovascular or renal disease
- immunodeficiency or hematologic diseases
- malignancies
- Medication with
- Systemic corticosteroids at inclusion
- ACE-inhibitor
- Acetylsalicylic acid/NSAID
- Warfarin, Phenprocoumon, NOAC and heparins

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Medical Gastroenterology, University Hospital of Southern Denmark - Esbjerg

facility.name: Department of Medical Gastroenterology, University Hospital of Southern Denmark
